lines.text: [last lines]

[voiceover]
If the people we love are stolen from us, the way to have them live on is to never stop loving them. Buildings burn, people die, but real love is forever.
Can't rain all the time...
[first lines]

[voiceover]
People once believed that when someone dies, a crow carries their soul to the land of the dead. But sometimes, something so bad happens that a terrible sadness is carried with it and the soul can't rest. Then sometimes, just sometimes, the crow can bring that soul back to put the wrong things right.
Police! Don't move! I said, "Don't move!"
I thought the police always said, "Freeze!"
Well, I am the police, and I say, "Don't move" Snow White. You move, you're dead.
And I say, "I'm dead," and I move.
Mother is the name for God on the lips and hearts of all children. Do you understand? Morphine is bad for you. Your daughter is out there on the streets waiting for you.
Little things used to mean so much to Shelly- I used to think they were kind of trivial. Believe me, nothing is trivial.
[Just before he stabs Tin-Tin]
Victims; aren't we all?
Suddenly I heard a tapping, as of someone gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.
What are you talking about?
You heard me rapping, right?
Is that gasoline I smell?
You're the guy that murdered Tin-Tin.
He was already dead. He died a year ago the moment he touched her. They're all dead. They just don't know it yet.
Abashed the Devil stood and felt how awful goodness is.
Take your shot, Funboy. You got me dead bang.
Jesus Christ!
Jesus Christ walks into a hotel.
[Fun Boy shoots him]
Ow! He hands the innkeeper three nails, and he asks...
[Fun Boy shoots him again]
Don't you ever fuckin' die?
Can you put me up for the night?
[after shooting the crow]
Caw! Caw! Bang! Fuck, I'm dead!

A building gets torched, all that is left is ashes. I used to think that was true about everything, families, friends, feelings. But now I know, that sometimes if love proves real, two people who are meant to be together, nothing can keep them apart.

What? What are you talking about? Nah, nah, nah, nah, nah. You mean that place downtown? Yeah, I remember her. We needed to put some fear into that little lady, she wasn't going along with our tenant relocation program. Then her idiot boyfriend shows up and turns a simple, sweeping clear into a total cluster fuck! Who gives a shit? It's ancient history. Why? What do you want? What is it? What? Speak to me! Speak!
[flashback of T-Bird and his gang breaking into Eric and Shelly's apartment]

[to Shelly]
Did you send us these complaints?
[hits Shelly and drags her by the hair]
Come here! "Abashed the devil stood-" Does it get you sweaty?
[T-Bird finally recognizes Eric]
I know you. I know you.
[laughs nervously]

I knew I knew you, I knew I knew you. But you ain't you. You can't be you. We put you through the window. There ain't no coming back. This is the really real world, there ain't no coming back. We killed you dead, there ain't no coming back! There ain't no coming back! There ain't no coming back!
Our friend T-bird won't be joining us this evening on account of a slight case of death.
I have something to give you. I don't want it anymore. Thirty hours of pain all at once, all for you.
Look, I'm beggin' you, alright? Don't kill me.
I'm not gonna kill you. Your job will be to tell the rest of them that death is coming for them, tonight. Tell them Eric Draven sends his regards.
I thought, you know, you were invincible!
I was. I'm not any more.
Do you know someone named T-bird? He had a friend who shouldn't have played with knives.
I love you.
Say that again.
I love you.
It's more like surfing than skating. I wish the rain would stop just once.
It can't rain all the time.
Eric?
now that's fun!
Great. A guy shows up looking like a mime from Hell and you lose him right out in the open. Well, at least he didn't do that walking against the wind shit, I hate that.
[gazing at falling-snow crystal ball containing a mini-cemetery]
Dad gave me this. Fifth birthday. He said, "Childhood's over the moment you know you're gonna die."
What are you supposed to be, a clown or something?
Sometimes.
I see you have made your decision, now let's see you enforce it.
Aw, this is already boring the shit out of me. Kill 'im!
[Top Dollar noticed the crow on the table]
How the hell did that thing get in here?
Gentlemen!
[after being shot by Top-dollar]
Hehe... aw fuck...
[Collapses on the ground]
A whole jolly club with jolly pirate nicknames!

Ya know, my daddy used to say every man's got a devil. And you can't rest 'til you find him. What happened back there with you and your girlfriend - I cleared that building. Hell, nothin' in this town happens without my say-so. So I'm sorry if I spoiled your wedding plans there, friend. But, if it's any consolation to you, you have put a smile on my face.
Guess it's not a good day to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?
I'm not Skank.
[turns his head to the side]
That's Skank right there. Skank's dead.
That's right.
[Eric recalls how Skank forcibly kissed Shelly and then throws Skank out the window]
So many cops, you'd think they givin' away donuts.
[Skank puts a gun to Tin Tin's head]
Fuck you, Tin Tin!
[Tin Tin puts a knife to Skank's throat]
Hey, that shit ain't even loaded, man.
[Funboy points a gun at Tin Tin]
This one is.
[T-Bird points a gun at all three of them]
Which of you Motor City motherfuckers wants to bet me this one isn't?
You shouldn't smoke these. They'll kill you.
For a ghost you bleed just fine.
[Skank is chasing T-bird in a wrecked Yugo]
Holy shit! God-damned foreign cars!
Goddamn creatures of the night. They never learn.
Are you gonna vanish into thin air again?
I thought I'd use your front door.
I saw him too. He had a guitar. He winked at me before he jumped out a fourth floor window like he had wings.
He winked at you?
[tsk]
Musicians.

[pointing a gun at Gideon]
You have one chance to live.
Look, man take anything you want.
Thank you.
TAKE ANYTHING!

[while searching for the wedding rings]
Warmer?

[Is held at the table due to the knife through his hand into the table]
WHAT ARE YOU DOING?
Don't you know this game?
Jesus, Albrecht, I can see why they took away your gold shield!
Yeah, I wasn't a big enough asshole.
FIRE IT UP! FIRE IT UP!
You ain't lost everything.
Yeah? And maybe you're not such a big shot, either!
[Grange restrains him]
Ow! Jesus!
Fair enough. Catch.
[Top Dollar tosses an eyeball at him]
Jesus.
Say hello to the last fella who wouldn't cooperate with me.
What are you telling me thi- You telling me this thing is real?
All the power in the world rests in the eyes, fella.
I got trouble. One of my crew got himself perished.
Yeah, and who might that be?
Tin Tin, somebody stuck his blades in all his major organs in alphabetical order.
Well, gentlemen, by all means, I think we oughta have an introspective moment of silence for poor ol' Tin Tin.
[sniffs drugs]
Murderer, man? Murderer? Let me tell you about murder. It's fun, it's easy, and you gonna learn all about it.
[pulls out two blades]
I'd like you to meet two buddies of mine. We never miss.
That piece of ratshit made Tin-Tin into a fucking voodoo doll!
Tin-Tin's a dick.
Tin-Tin.
Fire it up! Fire it up! Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up!

[checks his watch]
No Funboy.
Probably still banging away on Darla.

[whistles]
Smokes and road beers. Be quick.
I'm on it.
[Skank goes into the store while T-Bird gets into his car and notices he is not alone]

[sees Eric]
Who the fuck are you supposed to be, man?
I'm your passenger.
[Eric disarms T-Bird, and turns his head around]
Drive.
Look what you've done... to my sheets.
[Funboy pulls the trigger, blowing a hole in Eric Draven's hand]
Bingo! He shoots, he scores!
Mr. Gideon, you're not paying attention!

[shouting]
No! My hand!
A Gold engagement ring, yes? It was pawned here a year ago by a customer of yours named Tin Tin. He confided in me before he ran out of breath!
I think we broke her.
My livelihood got flushed and went swirling.
ARE WE HAVING FUN OR WHAT? Hey, you! What's your name? Skank? You don't feel that?
I feel like a little worm on a big fuckin' hook.
[All the other thugs laugh]
"I feel like a little worm on a big fucking hook." Well, boy, your mama must be damn proud of you!
Now Sarah, she's a genuine hot dogger. You hungry?
You buyin'?
I'm buyin'.
No onions though, okay?
No onions?
They make you fart, big time.

[mouth full of chips]
What's all this happy horseshit?
[Grange notices Gideon's burns]
You burn yourself playing with matches?
Fuck off.
You have an appointment.
Well, shit on me.
Drink up.
This is a first. Do I bow or do I curtsy?
It's all been done before, you see what I'm sayin'?
That's no reason to quit.
Wrong. Best reason to quit. *Only* reason to quit.
They got killed on devil's night, but they were gonna get married on Halloween? Who gets married on Halloween?
Nobody.
Somebody stuck his blades in all his major organs in alphabetical order.
So that, I take it, was the late, great Eric Draven.

[studying the crow's feather]
He has power. But it is power you can take from him.
I like him already.
The crow is his link between the land of the living, and the realm of the dead.
So, kill the crow... and destroy the man.
So you're him, huh? The Avenger. The Killer of Killers. Nice outfit. I'm not sure about the face, though.
You are seriously fucked up. Would you look in the mirror? I mean, you need professional help!
MURDERER!
I didn't murder nobody man. I don't even fucking know you, man. What the fuck you want, man?
A man and a woman in a loft a year ago.
You're outta your fucking mind.
LISTEN! I'm sure you'll remember. You killed them, on Halloween.
Yeah, yeah, right, I've got- Halloween, yeah. Some dude, some bitch, whatever, ma...
Her name was Shelly. You cut her, you raped her.
Shelly, yeah, yeah. I shagged her pink ass and she LOVED it!
[Eric winces at that statement and Tin-Tin decks him]
Oh for fuck's sake, die, will ya?
You know, Lake Erie actually caught on fire once from all the crap floating around in it. I wish I could've seen that.
What the hell do you call that?
I call it blood, detective. I suppose you'll write it up as "graffiti".
That's Tin-tin. One of T-Bird's little helpers. I think you can rule out accidental death.
Don't any of your street-demons have real grown-up names?

[to Albrecht]
I got a goddamned vigilante killer knocking off scumbags left and right. And you're covering up for somebody!

Okay, Gideon's blows all to hell and you're having a chitchat with some weirdo who winds up in T-Bird's car when it "zigs instead of zags". Then you steal one of my case files from homicide, and you're sayin' this is just a fuckin' automobile accident?
Department of Housing. Code violations, safety hazards... place looks fine to me. Let's redecorate.

[fast and hysterically]
That's him! That's him! But he looked different. He was all painted up white like some sort of dead whore! I seen him! T-Bird he sent me in some road beers, right? Then he took him away. But, I chased him down. And he flash fried T-bird to his fucking car! Aww, T-Bird here's to you buddy.
[drinks his flask]
Fire it up! Fire it up! Fire it up!
Maybe we oughta just video tape this, play it back in slow motion.
Did you see the grave?
Empty.

[still hysterical]
Grave? What grave? What about my fucking grave?
[Grange pushes him away]
Three out of four. He's working his way to this speed freak right here.

[still hysterical]
It's not fair. It's Funboy's fault. That boy was outta control. T-bird, he came in, said...
[whistles]
Waste them both! And now this ghost gonna kill my ass next!
[Top Dollar suddenly slaps him down]
